document_data.name: Wakanga O'tamu
document_data.text: Alas, it has been [[tenday|weeks]] since they were heard from, and I fear they did not, shall we say, make a profit for either themselves or me.
document_data.mainbody:
Wakanga befriended Syndra Silvane during her many visits to Port Nyanzaru, and when she was afflicted by the [[death curse]] many years later,{{ToA-time}} she stayed with him when she traveled back to Chult seeking a cure. However, he was willing to part with a journal in his possession that provided hints to the location of [[Vorn]]. When adventurers from [[Neverwinter]] arrived in the city also seeking to end the death curse, Wakanga provided them with a small compound from which to plan their expedition.

When [[Idrianne Smoke]] attacked Port Nyanzaru with her army of [[fiend]]ish pirates, Wakanga sought to retrieve a powerful ancient spell scroll from beneath the ziggurats of the [[Port Nyanzaru/Old City|Old City]] that would allow him to embolden the entire city's defenders at once.

At some point, Wakanga acquired an [[artifact]] from an unreputable merchant that was in fact being sought by a tribe of [[Batiri]] [[goblin]]s. The goblins stormed the city alongside a [[tyrannosaur]] and besieged his villa in an attempt to take it from him.

As of {{Yearlink|1492}},{{Waterdeep-time}} he was interested in acquiring magical treasures from the [[Sword Coast]], and on his behalf, Obaya Uday began sponsoring expeditions into [[Undermountain]].
document_data.Description: Wakanga was a wealthy [[Chultan (ethnicity)|Chultan]] merchant and the only [[arcane spellcaster]] among Port Nyanzaru's merchant princes. who had a masterful command of his Art.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|10}} He was capable of quickly learning ancient and powerful Chultan [[spell]]s.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|11}}

Activities.Business:
Wakanga held a monopoly over the sale of [[magic item]]s in the city of Port Nyanzaru, which mostly meant [[potion]]s and [[spell scroll]]s{{Cite adventurers league/Cauldron of Sapphire|4}} As it was illegal to buy or sell such items without his approval in the city, he had complete control over prices and rarely extended credit (although he was willing to trade for [[gemstone]]s and [[jewelry]] as part of his payment). In partnership with fellow merchant prince [[Ekene-Afa]], he also received a cut of all sales of [[enchanted]] [[weapon]]s and [[shield]]s as he was paid to provide the [[enchantment]]s. For explorers intending to travel underwater, Wakanga had a selection of items to offer, including ''[[potion of cold resistance|potions of cold resistance]]'', [[Freedom of movement|scrolls of ''freedom of movement'']], and [[Water breathing|scrolls]] or ''[[potion of water breathing|potions of water breathing]]''. He was also known to procure specific items or relics for special clients.

In addition to selling magic items, he was a [[loremaster]]{{Cite adventurers league/A Lesson in Love|8}} and dealt in the sale of information, [[map]]s, and ancient or lost lore. For example, this included knowledge of things such as the sites of long lost shrines to [[Ubtao]], testimonials and [[ritual]]s of ancient Chultans, or the locations of hidden treasures. He was well-versed in Chultan history—such as the theories surrounding Ubtao's abandonment of Chult—as well as current events of relevance to his city—such as the headquarters of certain pirate groups. He knew relatively little about lands to the [[Sword Coast|north]] of Chult, although he knew by reputation of such cities as [[Neverwinter]] and [[Waterdeep]]. He likewise knew little about the lost city of [[Omu]], although he was familiar with their [[Nine Trickster Gods]] and even honored those [[primal spirit|spirits]] to some extent.
Activities.Personal:
Wakanga maintained a personal collection and library of magic, lore, maps, and books (including [[spellbook]]s), some of which he was willing to gift, trade, or loan with adventurers.{{Cite adventurers league/A Lesson in Love|3}} and he was known to hire adventurers to retrieve new treasure maps, to explore ruins for magic items, and to delve into ancient temples to acquire idols or carved [[glyph]]s said to hum with Ubtao's magic.

He was known to cooperate with [[historian]]s seeking to learn more about Chult's past.

document_data.Possessions:
[[File:Wakanga.png|thumb|300px|''Prince O'tamu at his villa.'']]
He had an opulent and well-fortified villa in Port Nyanzaru. The walls were beautifully painted and decorated with hanging [[rug]]s. The mansion was lit by ''[[continual flame]]'' spells and by drifting balls of light, with magical [[music]] playing softly all throughout. The front doors could magically open on their own, while the interior doors to private rooms were protected with ''[[arcane lock]]'' spells. Many decorative items were in fact defensive measures, namely [[flying sword]]s hanging on the walls and [[rug of smothering|rugs of smothering]] on the floors. An outer courtyard contained a shrine to the [[god]]s.

His villa further had garden courtyards with innovative water features and housed his impressive menagerie.

He had his own fast [[boat]]s in the [[Port Nyanzaru/Harbor Ward|harbor]] that could quickly ferry his agents out to sea.
document_data.Relationships:
Wakanga was one of seven merchant princes who ruled Port Nyanzaru. Of the others, he had attracted the ire and jealously of [[Ifan Talro'a]] but was on good terms with Ekene-Afa{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|8}}

He had a business partner whose daughter, [[Teyileri Siwifi]], spent much of her idle time at his villa enjoying his menagerie.

Wakanga was acquainted with [[Niles Breakbone]] of the [[Order of the Gauntlet]]. Wakanga also became acquainted with [[Volo]] and [[Minsc]] during the late 15{{th}} century DR.

Wakanga was cousin to [[Bwayes O'tamu]], a [[weretiger]] that lived with a group of [[vegepygmies]] within a [[Narwhal (galleon)|wrecked ship]] in the middle of the jungle. As a child, Wakanga was quite close with Bwayes.

At his villa, a [[blacksmith]] named [[Tamrat Dejenhiwot]] had a [[forge]] in the outer courtyard.

He had an agent named [[Obaya Uday]], a [[priest]] of [[Waukeen]] who travelled to Waterdeep to procure magic items and [[spellbook]]s.
document_data.History:
By the time that Port Nyanzaru gained its independence from [[Amn]] in the late 15{{th}} century DR, Wakanga had become one of the richest people in Chult.
